articles.content: ORLANDO, Fla. -- Young women in Florida dressed up as older women in an apparent attempt to qualify for COVID-19 vaccination, a local official said Thursday.Dr. Raul Pino, the director of the Florida… [+1426 chars]

articles.author: WFLA 8 On Your Side Staff, WESH
articles.title: Women in Florida posed as ‘grannies’ to get coronavirus vaccine — and it worked, official says - WFLA
articles.description: Orange County Mayor Jerry Demings and Dr. Raul Pino from the Florida Department of Health in Orange County said the duo was busted when they tried to get their second shot on Wednesday at the Orange County Convention Center.
articles.content:
ORANGE COUNTY, Fla. (WFLA) Two women dressed up as elderly women with bonnets and glasses so they could get the coronavirus vaccine — and their trick worked, at least the first time.
